title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 107.8 - Nonresident snowmobiles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 107.8 - Nonresident snowmobiles

State Regulations
(a) A snowmobile owned by a nonresident and
operated in this State must be registered unless: (1)
the snowmobile is operated exclusively on
lands owned by the owner of the snowmobile, or on lands to which the snowmobile
owner has a contractual right to use, other than as a member of a club or
association, and no consideration is paid to the owner of the snowmobile with
respect to such operation; or
(2)
the snowmobile is operated exclusively on cross border trails designated by the

Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation, and the snowmobile
is validly registered in that border state. (b) Unless operated solely in accordance with
subdivision (a) of this section, a snowmobile owned by a nonresident and
registered in another state or province of Canada, and bearing registration
numbers on both sides of the cowl, must bear New York registration stickers
near the home state or province registration stickers or the operator must have
the owner's copy of NYS Registration Certificate -Snowmobile Terminal Document
(prepaid snowmobile registration form) with him or her. New York registration
numbers shall not be displayed on such a snowmobile. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
107.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
